poem:
Title: "The Lonesome End"

Cold hallways whisper dismal hymns,
In A&E, a father's tragic end.
Twain days of solitude, unjustified,  
His distress echoes in the silent tide.
Insanity, a spectre haunting in his wake,
Erring humanity with its brittle stake.
Death, the bleakest blessing, firm as stone,
No reason found in such lonesome drone.
